Angus Aitken

Angus Aitken was born in 1991 and grew up in London far from anywhere adventurous. He attended the same secondary school as Jack. Upon meeting the pair took an immediate disliking to each other and then spontaneously decided that actually they were really quite good friends. It was on his year out between school and university that Angus first discovered a lust for adventure. He cycled from John O’Groats to Landsend before moving on to bigger things: he taught English in Kerala for six months and founded the Mitranikaten Bicycle Club there. He then hitch-hiked from Bangkok to Hanoi before ending up in Northern Tanzania building a golf course for two months.   Angus went up to Oxford University in 2010 to read History and Politics. Determined to find a break from libraries he set out with Jack in the summer of his freshman year on an adventure to Outer Mongolia. Along with Jack he became convinced that somehow their adventure was worthy of a film; and so began their film making enterprise together.   Angus is currently making a film about 2TouchRulz football documenting a social enterprise which uses sport as a catalyst for changing people’s lives. In 2014 he plans an Orwellian-esque tour of Britain.
